intro: Chupalon nobilis, commonly known as the noble chupalon, is a rare flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, waxy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike. Due to habitat loss, Chupalon nobilis is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
